intro: Stevogtia, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species that are typically annual or biennial herbs with alternate, often hairy leaves. The flowers are composite, featuring yellow disk flowers surrounded by white or yellow ray florets. Stevogtia species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are often found in disturbed soils. They are characterized by their slender stems and are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value.
